p: Thereafter this team found that two synthetic flavaglines, FL3 ( 6, Fig. 1) and FL23 ( 7), and another PHB ligand structurally unrelated to flavaglines, were all able to inhibit CHIKV infection in mammalian cells and reduce viral production when cells were treated before infection [ 14]. Pretreatment of cells for only 15 min prior to infection followed by washing out of the compound resulted in significant inhibition of entry and as a consequence virus production, ruling out an involvement of eIF4 in these specific effects. As discussed, silverstol inhibits viral translation [ 8], indicating that the effects of flavaglines could be dual. On one hand they could inhibit PHB-dependent entry of CHIKV into microglial cells, and on the other hand they could block viral mRNA translation.
